channel.title: Delta - dropped item disappears if went away

item.title: Delta - dropped item disappears if went away
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“dsd575, post:7, topic:541996”][quote author=DAn0194 link=topic=660869.msg4418091#msg4418091 date=1396970291]

where do I call the Flooritems.loaditems(); code? Cuz I tried with a command and it worked charming! where do I put it?

I’m not really sure about the packet but in your client I think it’s case 241 or just look up loadObjects(); under that put FloorItem.loadItems();
[/quote]

couldn’t find that, but I am using it as a command atm. Thank you for your efforts. This forums is better than google, I waited 3 days to get an answer only 20 views, here 5 mins 10 views and an answer!![/quote]
Glad it’s working okay for you I found the packet id search packet 210 in your server and put it there.

Read full topic

item.source: Delta - dropped item disappears if went away

item.title: Delta - dropped item disappears if went away
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

You make a new class named FloorItem and add something like

[code=java5]import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

public class FloorItem {

private static List<FloorItem> floorItems = new ArrayList<FloorItem>();

public static void loadItems() {
	for(FloorItem floorItem : floorItems) {
		addItem(floorItem.getX(), floorItem.getY(), floorItem.getZ(), floorItem.getId());
	}
}

private int x;
private int y;
private int z;
private int id;

public FloorItem(int x, int y, int z, int id) {
	this.x = x;
	this.y = y;
	this.z = z;
	this.id = id;
}

public int getX() {
	return x;
}

public int getY() {
	return y;
}

public int getZ() {
	return z;
}

public int getId() {
	return id;
}

public static List<FloorItem> getFloorItems() {
	return floorItems;
}

}
[/code]

Knowing that you are using deltascape you probably have no region system or even location system which I recommend you changing sources but for now in your new load region packet add.

FloorItem.loadItems(); (big problem with this is that your looping through all the items throughout the world when if you had a region system you can just do it in that region).

Also when you drop an item add

And when you pick up and item add

Read full topic

item.title: Delta - dropped item disappears if went away
item.dc:creator: @dsd575 dsd575
item.description:
@dsd575 wrote:

DAn0194:

It’s because when you leave the region all the items leave. Maybe check your region packet to see if it’s deleting all the objects when you enter a new region or make something like a map to store all of the items dropped in that region and load it up when you get back to that region again.

Oh, didn’t think of that. Can you help me with that solution?

  • I think it is something to do with the itemhandler.java, but couldn’t get it x.x

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

It’s because when you leave the region all the items leave. Maybe check your region packet to see if it’s deleting all the objects when you enter a new region or make something like a map to store all of the items dropped in that region and load it up when you get back to that region again.

item.source: Delta - dropped item disappears if went away

item.title: Delta - dropped item disappears if went away
item.dc:creator: @dsd575 dsd575
item.description:
@dsd575 wrote:

Whenever I drop something, it gets dropped and I see it. But if i leave the place and come back it doesn’t appear to me anymore.

Like, Im in Varrock I drop scimitar. I tele to Lumbridge then come back to Varrock in 1sec, the dropped item dissappears. But if I stay in Varrock for around 10 minutes, the dropped item would never disappear, but if I go away from it, it does.

public void createGroundItem(int itemID, int itemX, int itemY, int itemAmount) { // Phate: creates item at absolute X and Y outStream.createFrame(85); // Phate: Spawn ground item outStream.writeByteC((itemY - 8 * mapRegionY)); outStream.writeByteC((itemX - 8 * mapRegionX)); outStream.createFrame(44); outStream.writeWordBigEndianA(itemID); outStream.writeWord(itemAmount); outStream.writeByte(0); // x(4 MSB) y(LSB) coords // System.out.println("CreateGroundItem "+itemID+" "+(itemX - 8 * // mapRegionX)+","+(itemY - 8 * mapRegionY)+" "+itemAmount); }

Read full topic
